text: I and the whole team were totally
devastated by what happened yesterday
when first and foremost our thoughts our
word those that were injured in their
families our heart goes out to them look
we our business is about giving people
safe fun memorable experiences and with
the emphasis on safety and yesterday
something dreadful happened you know
those two cars should not have been on
the same piece of track technically that
should not have happened when I arrived
here yesterday I took a decision that we
wouldn't open the park today
no the emergency services were on site
there's a lot of media but today we'll
be doing very deep and detailed
investigations we know though that there
were problems with the smiler there were
problems with this roller coaster it had
serious incidents before what did you
know about the problems and why was it
running well I think there's an awful
lot of misreporting going on about that
the smiler is a relatively new ride all
rights have teething problems when they
open and you know I've made the point to
other people that actually guest safety
on those sorts of incidents is not
really a major issue and since it when
you're on a roller coaster car the car
can't come off the track and you are
strapped in and you know restrained in
the seats so actually when you have a
collision the ride stops it's not really
an issue of safety to the riders you
know what happened yesterday is
something that there are other
fail-safes for you know there are
breaking locks it should stop two cars
being on the same section of track and
somehow that didn't work the way it was
meant to which is why we need to do the
investigation today can I just ask you
to comment some eyewitnesses have said
that they were concerned about the
amount of time it took people to reach
those injured in that carriage what do
you say to that well I've been heard
reports I mean I can't comment on all of
them I haven't had all the reports from
my own team the emergency services were
on site as quickly as possible as
usually I've done an excellent job one
of the complications was that they
wanted to get a stable platform before
removing the most seriously injured from
the ride but you know our team are very
well trained you know we go through
measures against these horrible
possibilities all of the time and I
would say probably that in a
there wouldn't have been any laxness in
our reaction to it
